body:
DATA COLLECTION AND USE:

Personal Information Collected:
{{personal_info_collected}}

Health Information Collected:
{{health_info_collected}}

Data Use Purposes:
- Analysis for this specific trial
- Regulatory submissions
- Publication in scientific journals
- Future related research (with separate consent)

DATA PROTECTION:

Confidentiality Measures:
- All data de-identified for analysis
- Unique participant ID assigned
- Secure data storage systems
- Limited access to authorized personnel only
- Regular security audits

Data Retention:
- Raw data retained for {{data_retention_period}} years
- Published data retained indefinitely
- Personal identifiers destroyed after {{identifier_destruction_period}}

ACCESS TO YOUR INFORMATION:

Who May Access Your Data:
- Principal investigator and research team
- Regulatory authorities ({{regulatory_authorities}})
- Ethics committee members
- Trial monitors and auditors
- Sponsor representatives (if applicable)

YOUR RIGHTS:

- Right to access your personal information
- Right to request correction of errors
- Right to withdraw consent for data use
- Right to complain to privacy commissioner

Data sharing outside Australia: {{international_data_sharing}}

Publication of results will not include any information that could identify you personally.

title: WITHDRAWAL AND TERMINATION
body:
YOUR RIGHT TO WITHDRAW:

Voluntary Participation:
- Your participation is entirely voluntary
- You may withdraw at any time without giving reasons
- Withdrawal will not affect your future medical care
- Withdrawal will not affect your legal rights

Withdrawal Process:
1. Inform the trial team of your decision
2. Complete final safety assessment (recommended)
3. Return trial materials if applicable
4. Discuss ongoing care needs with your doctor

Partial Withdrawal Options:
- Stop trial intervention but continue follow-up visits
- Stop study visits but allow data analysis
- Complete withdrawal from all aspects

DATA USE AFTER WITHDRAWAL:

Data collected before withdrawal:
{{data_use_post_withdrawal}}

TRIAL TERMINATION BY INVESTIGATORS:

The trial team may withdraw you from the trial if:
- You no longer meet eligibility criteria
- Serious adverse events occur
- You cannot comply with trial requirements
- The trial is terminated early
- Medical reasons require withdrawal

EARLY TRIAL TERMINATION:

The entire trial may be stopped early if:
- Safety concerns arise
- Sufficient data has been collected
- Sponsor decision
- Regulatory authority decision
- Lack of efficacy

You will be informed immediately if the trial is terminated early.

FOLLOW-UP CARE:

After withdrawal or trial completion:
- Return to regular medical care
- Continued monitoring if medically necessary: {{post_trial_monitoring}}
- Access to trial results: {{results_access}}

title: CONTACT INFORMATION AND COMPLAINTS
LEGAL LIABILITY AND INSURANCE
body:
RESEARCH-RELATED INJURY:

Insurance Coverage:
This trial is covered by {{insurance_type}} insurance provided by {{insurance_provider}}.

Policy Number: {{policy_number}}
Coverage Amount: {{coverage_amount}}
Contact: {{insurance_contact}}

What is Covered:
- Medical treatment for research-related injury
- Compensation for research-related harm
- Legal costs (if applicable)
- Lost income due to research-related injury: {{income_coverage}}

What is NOT Covered:
- Pre-existing medical conditions
- Injuries due to non-compliance with protocol
- Injuries from standard medical care
- Pain and suffering (unless negligence proven)

Claims Process:
1. Report injury immediately to trial team
2. Seek appropriate medical treatment
3. Complete incident report forms
4. Insurance company will investigate
5. Compensation determined based on investigation

LEGAL RIGHTS:

Nothing in this agreement removes your legal rights:
- Right to seek legal advice
- Right to pursue compensation through courts
- Right to report professional misconduct
- Consumer protection rights

LIMITATION OF LIABILITY:

{{liability_limitations}}

INDEMNITY:

You agree to:
- Provide accurate health information
- Follow trial procedures as instructed
- Report adverse events promptly
- Not hold individual researchers personally liable (except for negligence)

GOVERNING LAW:

This agreement is governed by the laws of {{governing_jurisdiction}}.

Disputes will be resolved in the courts of {{court_jurisdiction}}.
